title: GE Chief Says Assets Sales Will Reap $38 Billion
text:
General Electric Co. Chief Executive Larry Culp said he expects asset sales to bring in about $38 billion in cash for the company as it begins paring down its large debt load, and there are signs the long-struggling power division is gaining strength.

Speaking at a Morgan Stanley investor conference Thursday, Mr. Culp also said falling interest rates will increase GE’s pension benefits obligation by about $7 billion net of investment returns and its insurance reserve funding by less than $1.5 billion. Neither of the adjustments...
description: CEO Larry Culp sees stronger demand at the company’s power division but warns interest rates will boost pension obligations by $7 billion.
